guides.title: What Do Giant Pandas Eat?

steps.title: Main diet
content: Pandas eat: Bamboo stalks, leaves, and shoots (their favorite)
steps.hint: Shoots are the richest in nutrients.

steps.title: Occasional extras
content: Sometimes pandas may eat: Small rodents, Birds, Eggs, Insects
steps.hint: This makes up only 1% of their diet.

steps.title: Daily intake
content: Pandas eat 12–38 kg (26–84 lbs) of bamboo per day
They prefer young shoots in spring and leaves in winter
steps.hint: Feeding is their main activity during the day.

steps.title: Why bamboo?
steps.hint: They have a 'pseudo-thumb' to hold bamboo like a hand!

summary: Pandas must eat huge amounts because bamboo is low-calorie.
Without bamboo forests, pandas cannot survive.

faq.question: Are pandas herbivores?
faq.answer: Not biologically — they are classified as carnivores, but functionally they eat like herbivores.

faq.question: Do pandas eat meat regularly?
faq.answer: No. Their bodies are not adapted to digest much animal protein.

faq.question: Why do they eat so much?
faq.answer: Bamboo contains very few calories, so they need large quantities for energy.
